title: AI’s future sparks theological and ethical debate on human dignity
description: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) and Artificial Super-Intelligence (ASI) are at the center of this debate. While developers in Silicon Valley predict their arrival, the study warns that no current evidence suggests machines can achieve the level of conscious agency characteristic of human beings. The author stresses that achieving AGI would require a radical transformation of current AI architectures to enable emotional, empathetic, and embodied interaction with the world. Without such qualities, AI remains a tool rather than a moral agent.
